## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

```{r}
gmailAddress <- c(
  "tim@gmail.com",
  "anita",
  "yellen@gmail.com",
  "huang@gmail.com"
)

library(stringr)

for(i in seq_along(gmailAddress)){
  if(!(str_detect(gmailAddress[[i]],"@gmali.com"))){
    gmailAddress[[i]] <- str_c(gmailAddress[[i]],"@gmali.com")
  }
}
gmailAddress
```


```{r}
library(stringr)
for(i in seq_along(gmailAddress)){
  if (str_detect(gmailAddress[[i]],"@gmail.com")){
    print(gmailAddress[[i]])}
  else{
    print(str_c(gmailAddress[[i]],"@gmail.com"))
  }

}
```
```{r}
# 開始設定
gmailAddress <- c(
  "tim@gmail.com",
  "anita",
  "yellen@gmail.com",
  "huang@gmail.com"
)
cat("起始狀況\n")
gmailAddress

# for loop
for(i in seq_along(gmailAddress)){
  if(!str_detect(gmailAddress[[i]],"@gmail.com")){
    correctGmailAddress <-
      str_c(gmailAddress[[i]],"@gmail.com")
    gmailAddress[[i]] <- correctGmailAddress
  }
}

cat("修正後狀況\n")
gmailAddress
_


 

```
